intro: Monochaetum quadrangulare, commonly known as the quadrangular lily, is a striking plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes a variety of ornamental grasses and lilies. The plant is characterized by its distinctive quadrangular (four-sided) stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or swampy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
